info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on Tag entity in your Azure API Management deployment. Tags can be assigned to APIs, Operations and Products.
info.title: ApiManagementClient

get.description: Lists a collection of tags defined within a service instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions               |
|-------------|------------------------|-----------------------------------|

|name | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith|
|displayName | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith|
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: Number of records to return.
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Number of records to skip.
parameters.name: $skip

parameters.description: Scope like 'apis', 'products' or 'apis/{apiId}
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: Lists a collection of Tag entities.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

delete.description: Deletes specific tag of the API Management service instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Tag identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.
parameters.name: tagId

parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.
parameters.name: If-Match

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

204.description: Tag successfully removed by previous request or does not exist

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

get.description: Gets the details of the tag specified by its identifier.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Tag identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.
parameters.name: tagId

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: The response body contains the specified Tag entity.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
